global_flags.description: alignment  for  newly  created  partitions, valid alignment types are:
in script mode, fix instead of abort when asked
lists partition layout on all block devices

subcommands.name: Change
subcommands.description: a flag on the disk to state. A flag can be either "on" or "off".  Some or all of these flags will be avail‐ able, depending on what disk label you are  using.   Sup‐ ported  flags  are: "pmbr_boot" on GPT to enable the boot flag on the GPT's protective MBR partition.

subcommands.name: Choose
subcommands.description: device  as  the  current  device  to edit. device should usually be a Linux hard disk device, but it can be a partition, software raid device, or an LVM logical vol‐ ume if necessary.

subcommands.name: Create
subcommands.description: a  new disklabel (partition table) of label-type. label-type should be one of "aix", "amiga", "bsd", "dvh", "gpt", "loop", "mac", "msdos", "pc98", or "sun".

subcommands.name: On
subcommands.description: MS-DOS set the type aka. partition id of partition to id. The id is a value between "0x01" and "0xff".  On  GPT the type-uuid of partition to uuid.

subcommands.name: Rescue
subcommands.description: a  lost  partition that was located somewhere be‐ tween start and end.  If a  partition  is  found,  parted will  ask  if  you  want to create an entry for it in the partition table.

subcommands.name: Specifies
subcommands.description: the  command to be executed.  If no command is given, parted will present a command prompt.  Possible commands are:

subcommands.name: align-check
subcommands.description: check partition N for TYPE(min|opt)

subcommands.name: disk_set
subcommands.description: change the FLAG on selected device

subcommands.name: disk_toggle
subcommands.description: toggle the state of FLAG on selected

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: print general help, or help on

subcommands.name: mklabel
subcommands.description: create a new disklabel (partition table)

subcommands.name: mkpart
subcommands.description: make a partition

subcommands.name: name
subcommands.description: name partition NUMBER as NAME

subcommands.name: quit
subcommands.description: Exit from parted.

subcommands.name: rescue
subcommands.description: rescue a lost partition near START and END

subcommands.name: resizepart
subcommands.description: resize partition NUMBER

subcommands.name: rm
subcommands.description: delete partition NUMBER

subcommands.name: select
subcommands.description: choose the device to edit

subcommands.name: set
subcommands.description: change the FLAG on partition NUMBER

subcommands.name: toggle
subcommands.description: toggle the state of FLAG on partition

subcommands.name: unit
subcommands.description: set the default unit to UNIT

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: display the version number and copyright information of GNU Parted
